articles.author: Ann Saphir
articles.description: The annual rotation on the U.S. Federal Reserve’s interest-rate-setting committee means its 2024 voting members lean slightly more hawkish than the outgoing group from 2023 – but that won’t budge the outlook for a pivot to interest-rate cuts next year.
articles.title: Fed rate cuts firmly in view for 2024, even as rate-setters shift

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Annual U.S. inflation slowed further below 3% in November and underlying price pressures continued to abate, which could cement financial market expectations for an interest rate cut next March.
articles.title: US annual inflation slows further below 3% in November

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday added Russia's biggest car dealership - Rolf - to a list of foreign-owned companies put under the temporary management of the Russian state.
articles.title: Russian state takes temporary ownership of biggest car dealership - decree

articles.author: Oksana Kobzeva
articles.description: Russia is hoping its shipments of liquefied natural gas (LNG) will offset a sharp fall in pipeline gas exports to Europe, but a shortage of gas tankers and sanctions hold back its plans, analysts and industry sources said.
articles.title: Lack of Arctic tankers puts Russia's LNG development dreams on ice

articles.author: Michael Erman, Manas Mishra
articles.description: Bristol Myers Squibb (BMY.N) on Friday agreed to buy Karuna Therapeutics (KRTX.O) for $14 billion, gaining a promising new type of antipsychotic medicine to help power growth as patents on its older therapies expire later this decade.
articles.title: Bristol Myers to buy schizophrenia drugmaker Karuna Therapeutics for $14 bln

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese regulators announced on Friday a wide range of rules aimed at curbing spending and rewards that encourage video games, dealing a blow to the world's biggest games market, which returned to growth this year.
articles.title: China issues rules to curb gaming spend; Tencent, NetEase plunge

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Blank-check firm Screaming Eagle Acquisition Corp (SCRM.O) said on Friday it has agreed to merge with the studio business of entertainment company Lionsgate (LGFa.N) in a deal valued at about $4.6 billion, sending shares of both companies up before the bell.
articles.title: Lionsgate signs $4.6-billion SPAC deal for studio business

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations Security Council on Friday approved a toned-down bid to boost humanitarian aid to the Gaza Strip and called for urgent steps "to create the conditions for a sustainable cessation of hostilities" after a week of vote delays and intense negotiations to avoid a veto by the United States.
articles.title: UN Security Council acts to boost aid to Gaza after US abstains

articles.author: Wendell Roelf
articles.description: Shipping companies sailing around the Cape of Good Hope to avoid Houthi attacks on the Red Sea face tough choices over where to refuel and restock, as African ports struggle with red tape, congestion and poor facilities, companies and analysts say.
articles.title: Ships rerouted by Red Sea crisis face overwhelmed African ports

articles.author: Johann Cherian, Shristi A
articles.description: Wall Street's main indexes gained on Friday after a key inflation reading came in softer than expected, boosting recent investor optimism that the Federal Reserve could lower borrowing costs next year.
articles.title: Wall St rises after soft inflation data; Nike slides
